title: [Large-Scale] Reflective Thinking and Mathematical Modeling Development Course for Prospective Physics Teachers: Project-Based Approach

context.prior_knowledge: Foundational physics theories, basic pedagogical knowledge, proficiency in basic mathematical formulas (equations, functions, differential equations) and graph interpretation, and understanding of probability/statistics basics (regression analysis, correlation, statistical significance)
context.additional_context: Fostering reflective thinking via e-portfolios in a smartphone-centric limited-technology environment, tailored for in-service corporate professionals. Includes activities modeling physical phenomena with mathematical models (differential equations, simulations). Emphasizes data-driven decision-making and graph interpretation skills, developing mathematical thinking through experimental data collection/analysis, model validation, and result visualization

learning_goals: Across 3 stages (instructional design, lesson demonstration, video production), learners will solve physics problems via reflective thinking and mathematical modeling (equations, functions, differential equations) using graph/simulation-based approaches.

Learners will analyze 3 dimensions (focus, inquiry, change) and 4 levels (routine, technical, dialogic, transformative) of reflective thinking using mathematical formulas (regression, function modeling, statistical significance tests) and visualization tools (graphs, charts, simulations).

Learners practice dialogic-level reflective thinking through peer feedback and probabilistic analysis (statistical significance testing, correlation analysis) and interpret educational data using statistical methods (mean, standard deviation, variance analysis).

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
